headline: Ford to offer its first eyes-off driver-assistance system in 2028
summary: LAS VEGAS, Jan 7 (Reuters) - Ford Motor said on Wednesday it would bring Level 3 driver-assistance systems to market in 2028, allowing drivers to take their hands and eyes off the road while operating on certain ​highways. The technology will first be available on Ford's new electric vehicle platform being developed by a specialized team in California, the ‌company said, with plans to expand to other vehicles in the future.
